meanings.definition: The state or quality of being diploid, having two sets of chromosomes.
meanings.sent1: Diploidy is when an organism has two sets of chromosomes.
meanings.sent2: The diploidy of humans means we have two sets of chromosomes in each cell.
meanings.sent3: The party of chromosomes celebrated the diploidy of their friend with a cake shaped like a double helix.
meanings.sent4: In the world of genetics, diploidy is like having a backup copy of all your genetic information.
meanings.sent5: The concept of diploidy can be compared to having a spare key for every lock in your house.

meanings.definition: The condition of having two complete sets of chromosomes in a cell or organism.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study diploidy to understand how cells have two complete sets of chromosomes.
meanings.sent2: Diploidy is essential for the proper functioning of many organisms.
meanings.sent3: The diploidy of the cell was so impressive that it won the 'Best Chromosome Collection' award.
meanings.sent4: The symphony of life plays harmoniously thanks to the diploidy of genetic material.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of diploidy lies in the redundancy that ensures genetic stability.
